mlclient.model package

The ML Model package.

It contains modules with a corresponding Python representation of MarkLogic-related data structures:

  • data

    The ML Data module.

This package exports the following classes:

  • DocumentType

    An enumeration class representing document types.

  • Document

    A class representing a single MarkLogic document.

  • JSONDocument

    A Document implementation representing a single MarkLogic JSON document.

  • XMLDocument

    A Document implementation representing a single MarkLogic XML document.

  • TextDocument

    A Document implementation representing a single MarkLogic TEXT document.

  • BinaryDocument

    A Document implementation representing a single MarkLogic BINARY document.

  • RawDocument

    A Document implementation representing a single MarkLogic document.

  • RawStringDocument

    A Document implementation representing a single MarkLogic document.

  • MetadataDocument

    A Document implementation representing a single MarkLogic document’s metadata.

  • DocumentFactory

    A factory class instantiating a Document implementation classes.

  • MetadataFactory

    A factory class instantiating a Metadata class from a file.

  • Metadata

    A class representing MarkLogic’s document metadata.

  • Permission:

    A class representing MarkLogic’s document permission.

  • Mimetype

    A class representing mime type

Examples

>>> from mlclient.model import Document, DocumentType, Metadata
class mlclient.model.BinaryDocument(content: bytes, uri: str | None = None, metadata: Metadata | None = None, temporal_collection: str | None = None)[source]

A Document implementation representing a single MarkLogic BINARY document.

This implementation stores content in bytes format.

class mlclient.model.DocumentFactory[source]

Bases: object

A factory class instantiating a Document implementation classes.

classmethod build_document(content: ElemTree.Element | dict | str | bytes | None = None, doc_type: DocumentType | str | None = None, uri: str | None = None, metadata: Metadata | None = None, temporal_collection: str | None = None) → Document[source]

Instantiate Document based on the document or content type.

Parameters:

  • content (ElemTree.Element | dict | str | bytes | None, default None) – A document content

  • doc_type (DocumentType | str | None, default None) – A document type

  • uri (str | None, default None) – A document URI

  • metadata (Metadata | None, default None) – A document metadata

  • temporal_collection (str | None, default None) – The temporal collection

Returns:

A Document implementation instance

Return type:

Document

classmethod build_raw_document(content: bytes | str, doc_type: DocumentType | str, uri: str | None = None, metadata: bytes | str | None = None, temporal_collection: str | None = None) → Document[source]

Instantiate Document based on the document type.

Parameters:

  • content (bytes | str) – A document content

  • doc_type (DocumentType | str) – A document type

  • uri (str | None, default None) – A document URI

  • metadata (bytes | str | None, default None) – A document metadata

  • temporal_collection (str | None, default None) – The temporal collection

Returns:

A raw Document implementation instance

Return type:

Document

Raises:

NotImplementedError – If content type is neither bytes nor str

class mlclient.model.Metadata(collections: list | None = None, permissions: list | None = None, properties: dict | None = None, quality: int = 0, metadata_values: dict | None = None)[source]

Bases: object

A class representing MarkLogic’s document metadata.

add_collection(collection: str) → bool[source]

Assign a new collection to document.

Parameters:

collection (str) – A document’s new collection

Returns:

allow – True if the collection is non-blank value, and it does not appear already in document’s collections. Otherwise, False.

Return type:

bool

add_permission(role_name: str, capability: str) → bool[source]

Assign a new permission to document.

Parameters:

  • role_name (str) – a permission’s role name

  • capability (str) – a permission’s capability

Returns:

True if there’s no such capability assigned to this role already, and it is a correct one. Otherwise, False.

Return type:

bool

collections() → list[source]

Return document’s collections.

metadata_values() → dict[source]

Return document’s metadata values.

permissions() → list[source]

Return document’s permissions.

properties() → dict[source]

Return document’s properties.

put_metadata_value(name: str, value: str)[source]

Assign a new metadata value to document.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – A metadata name

  • value (str) – A metadata value

put_property(name: str, value: str)[source]

Assign a new property to document.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – A property name

  • value (str) – A property value

quality() → int[source]

Return document’s quality.

remove_collection(collection: str) → bool[source]

Remove a collection from document.

Parameters:

collection (str) – A document’s collection

Returns:

allow – True if the collection is assigned to the document. Otherwise, False.

Return type:

bool

remove_metadata_value(name: str) → bool[source]

Remove a metadata value from document.

Parameters:

name (str) – A metadata name

Returns:

True if the document has a metadata with such name. Otherwise, False.

Return type:

bool

remove_permission(role_name: str, capability: str) → bool[source]

Remove a permission from document.

Parameters:

  • role_name (str) – A permission’s role name

  • capability (str) – A permission’s capability

Returns:

True if the capability is assigned to the role for a document. Otherwise, False.

Return type:

bool

remove_property(name: str) → bool[source]

Remove a property from document.

Parameters:

name (str) – A property name

Returns:

True if the document has a property with such name. Otherwise, False.

Return type:

bool

set_quality(quality: int) → bool[source]

Set document’s quality.

Parameters:

quality (int) – A document’s new quality

Returns:

allow – True if value provided is an integer. Otherwise, False.

Return type:

bool

to_json() → dict[source]

Return a JSON representation of the Metadata instance.

Metadata in a stringified JSON representation

str

class mlclient.model.MetadataDocument(uri: str, metadata: Metadata)[source]

A Document implementation representing a single MarkLogic document’s metadata.

This implementation does not store any content.

pydantic model mlclient.model.Mimetype[source]

Bases: BaseModel

A class representing a mime type.

Show JSON schema
{
   "title": "Mimetype",
   "description": "A class representing a mime type.",
   "type": "object",
   "properties": {
      "mime-type": {
         "title": "Mime-Type",
         "type": "string"
      },
      "extensions": {
         "items": {
            "type": "string"
         },
         "title": "Extensions",
         "type": "array"
      },
      "doc-type": {
         "$ref": "#/$defs/DocumentType"
      }
   },
   "$defs": {
      "DocumentType": {
         "description": "An enumeration class representing document types.",
         "enum": [
            "xml",
            "json",
            "binary",
            "text"
         ],
         "title": "DocumentType",
         "type": "string"
      }
   },
   "required": [
      "mime-type",
      "extensions",
      "doc-type"
   ]
}

Fields:

  • document_type (mlclient.model.data.DocumentType)

  • extensions (List[str])

  • mime_type (str)

field document_type: DocumentType [Required] (alias 'doc-type')
field extensions: List[str] [Required]
field mime_type: str [Required] (alias 'mime-type')
class mlclient.model.Permission(role_name: str, capabilities: set)[source]

Bases: object

A class representing MarkLogic’s document permission.

EXECUTE: str = 'execute'
INSERT: str = 'insert'
READ: str = 'read'
UPDATE: str = 'update'
UPDATE_NODE: str = 'update-node'
add_capability(capability: str) → bool[source]

Assign a new capability to the role.

Parameters:

capability (str) – a permission’s capability

Returns:

allow – True if there’s no such capability assigned to this role already, and it is a correct one. Otherwise, False.

Return type:

bool

capabilities() → set[source]

Return permission’s capabilities.

remove_capability(capability: str) → bool[source]

Remove a capability from the role.

Parameters:

capability (str) – a permission’s capability

Returns:

allow – True if the capability is assigned to the role. Otherwise, False.

Return type:

bool

role_name() → str[source]

Return permission’s role name.

to_json() → dict[source]

Return a JSON representation of the Permission instance.
